question: Recently, FDA has approved Genvoya, a single-tablet drug as complete treatment for which disease?
explanation: Genvoya is a new single-tablet drug has been approved by Food and Drug Administration (FDA) as a complete treatment for HIV. Genvoya contains a new form of the powerful antiviral medication tenofovir, which slows progression of the virus. This new form of the medication enters the bodyâ€™s cells, including those infected with HIV and where the virus replicates, more efficiently than previous forms of tenofovir.
